page.title: 18WELLS AND WATER
page.content: The area at the top of Rainow Road is hilly and begins to open out on to more open country. Set back from the main road, going downhill, is Well Lane,so called because of the wells which abound. Not all are visible, one is in a private garden,another is in a field along a rough track with a natural spring bubbling nearby, while at the entrance to Lower Fold Farm a boulder backed by flowers covers a well to protect pedestrians and cars. There is no shortage of water in this district.By contrast, at the bottom of the same road a small industrial estate is being developed. New buildings spread into open farmland,while an old mill now provides a Tyre Fitting and Repair service for private and industrial vehicles.Between these extremes stands Hurdsfield Church.
